Class PicoP_Api

  • java.lang.Object
    • picop.interfaces.def.PicoP_Api
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPicoP_Api

    public class PicoP_Api
extends java.lang.Object
implements IPicoP_Api
    This class implements the interface for PicoP Display and Sensing API's

      • PicoP_OpenLibrary

        public PicoP_RC PicoP_OpenLibrary(PicoP_Handle connectionHandle)
        Description copied from interface: IPicoP_Api
        Opens the interface library and allocates resources necessary for operation. Returns a handle to the library to be used for opening a connection to the PSE. The application must call the PicoP_OpenLibrary() function first to populate connectionHandle that can then be used to open a communications connection.
        Specified by:
        PicoP_OpenLibrary in interface IPicoP_Api
        Parameters:
        connectionHandle - A pointer to a PicoP_Handle that is set to an open handle of the library
        Returns:
        PicoP_RC

      • PicoP_CloseLibrary

        public PicoP_RC PicoP_CloseLibrary(PicoP_Handle connectionHandle)
        Description copied from interface: IPicoP_Api
        Closes the library, releases all resources and closes all open connections. This function should be called last upon exiting the application.
        Specified by:
        PicoP_CloseLibrary in interface IPicoP_Api
        Parameters:
        connectionHandle - A valid PicoP_Handle previously obtained by a call to PicoP_OpenLibrary()
        Returns:
        PicoP_RC

      • PicoP_SetInputVideoState

        public PicoP_RC PicoP_SetInputVideoState(PicoP_Handle connectionHandle,
                                         PicoP_InputVideoStateE state,
                                         boolean bCommit)
        Description copied from interface: IPicoP_Api
        This function enables or disables the PSE input video interface. When the input video is disabled, the PSE frame buffer will not be updated and the output video will contain the last received frame.
        Specified by:
        PicoP_SetInputVideoState in interface IPicoP_Api
        Parameters:
        connectionHandle - A valid library PicoP_Handle previously obtained by a call to PicoP_OpenLibrary()
        state - Enable/Disable as defined in PicoP_InputVideoStateE
        bCommit - False = Do not persist (value restored back after power cycle), True = Persist setting
        Returns:
        PicoP_RC

      • PicoP_SetColorMode

        public PicoP_RC PicoP_SetColorMode(PicoP_Handle connectionHandle,
                                   PicoP_ColorModeE colorMode,
                                   boolean bCommit)
        Description copied from interface: IPicoP_Api
        The PSE projection display utilized Red (640 nm), Green (532 nm), Blue (450 nm) laser diodes as light sources to illuminate the scanned beam projection display. The laser diodes enable the PSE to provide a wide gamut of brilliant and reproducible colors. This expanded color gamut is significantly larger than standard color gamuts, such as sRBG. This function sets the PSE color mode.
        Specified by:
        PicoP_SetColorMode in interface IPicoP_Api
        Parameters:
        connectionHandle - A valid library PicoP_Handle previously obtained by a call to PicoP_OpenLibrary()
        colorMode - Modes as defined in PicoP_ColorModeE
        bCommit - False = Do not persist (value restored back after power cycle), True = Persist setting
        Returns:
        PicoP_RC

      • PicoP_GetColorMode

      • PicoP_SetGamma

        public PicoP_RC PicoP_SetGamma(PicoP_Handle connectionHandle,
                               PicoP_ColorE color,
                               float gammaValue,
                               boolean bCommit)
        Description copied from interface: IPicoP_Api
        Gamma is the relationship between the numerical value of a pixel in an image file and the brightness of the projected pixel when viewed on screen. This relationship is non-linear, meaning that a change in pixel value does not translate into an equivalent change in brightness. For almost all TVs and computer monitors, a change in pixel value results in a change in brightness raised to the 2.2 power. The gamma for these devices, therefore, is said to be 2.2. This function allows the host to manipulate/adjust the gamma setting of each displayed primary display.
        Specified by:
        PicoP_SetGamma in interface IPicoP_Api
        Parameters:
        connectionHandle - A valid library PicoP_Handle previously obtained by a call to PicoP_OpenLibrary()
        color - Color as defined in PicoP_ColorE
        gammaValue - A floating point value for gamma, range 1.0 - 3.0
        bCommit - False = Do not persist (value restored back after power cycle), True = Persist setting
        Returns:
        PicoP_RC

      • PicoP_GetGamma

        public PicoP_RC PicoP_GetGamma(PicoP_Handle connectionHandle,
                               PicoP_Api.PicoP_Callback callback,
                               PicoP_ColorE color,
                               PicoP_ValueStorageTypeE storageType)
        Description copied from interface: IPicoP_Api
        Returns the current display gamma value.
        Specified by:
        PicoP_GetGamma in interface IPicoP_Api
        Parameters:
        connectionHandle - A valid library PicoP_Handle previously obtained by a call to PicoP_OpenLibrary()
        callback - Callback to store current float gamma value
        color - Boost mode for the color as defined in PicoP_ColorE
        storageType - Storage Type as defined in PicoP_ValueStorageTypeE
        Returns:
        PicoP_RC

      • PicoP_SetVideoGammaBoostMode

        public PicoP_RC PicoP_SetVideoGammaBoostMode(PicoP_Handle connectionHandle,
                                             PicoP_ColorE color,
                                             PicoP_GammaBoostModeE boostMode,
                                             boolean bCommit)
        Description copied from interface: IPicoP_Api
        The PSE supports an Enhanced Brightness mode which is achieved by boosting the brightness of video codes around code level 0.3 (or 76 of 255). These video code values are the most common in typical pictures and movie frames. When the Gamma Boost mode is enabled, the brightness of these video codes is increased up to 30% to correspond to a ~30% brighter display when typical pictures or movies. This function allows boost to be performed to individual primary colors.
        Specified by:
        PicoP_SetVideoGammaBoostMode in interface IPicoP_Api
        Parameters:
        connectionHandle - A valid library PicoP_Handle previously obtained by a call to PicoP_OpenLibrary()
        color - Color as defined in PicoP_ColorE
        boostMode - Boost Mode as defined in PicoP_GammaBoostModeE
        bCommit - False = Do not persist (value restored back after power cycle), True = Persist setting
        Returns:
        PicoP_RC

      • PicoP_GetVideoGammaBoostMode

        public PicoP_RC PicoP_GetVideoGammaBoostMode(PicoP_Handle connectionHandle,
                                             PicoP_Api.PicoP_Callback callback,
                                             PicoP_ColorE color,
                                             PicoP_ValueStorageTypeE storageType)
        Description copied from interface: IPicoP_Api
        Returns gamma boost mode for a given color.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        callback - Callback to store current PicoP_GammaBoostModeE
        color - Boost mode for the color as defined in PicoP_ColorE

        Returns:
        PicoP_RC

      • PicoP_SetColorConverter

        public PicoP_RC PicoP_SetColorConverter(PicoP_Handle connectionHandle,
                                        PicoP_ColorConvertE color,
                                        int nCoefficient,
                                        boolean bCommit)
        Description copied from interface: IPicoP_Api
        The PSE Color converter is a 3x3 matrix that allows the display colors to be remapped. This function sets the color converter value for a specific color pair in the 3x3 color converter matrix.
        Specified by:
        PicoP_SetColorConverter in interface IPicoP_Api
        Parameters:
        connectionHandle - A valid library PicoP_Handle previously obtained by a call to PicoP_OpenLibrary()
        color - Color pair as defined in PicoP_ColorConvertE
        nCoefficient - Value for the color converter (Range -65536 ... +65535)
        bCommit - False = Do not persist (value restored back after power cycle), True = Persist setting
        Returns:
        PicoP_RC

      • PicoP_GetColorConverter

        public PicoP_RC PicoP_GetColorConverter(PicoP_Handle connectionHandle,

      • PicoP_SetBiPhase

        public PicoP_RC PicoP_SetBiPhase(PicoP_Handle connectionHandle,
                                 short sPhaseValue,
                                 boolean bCommit)
        Description copied from interface: IPicoP_Api
        The PicoP Laser Beam Scanning display illuminates pixels during both horizonal left to right and right to left scans. The PSE automatically adjusts the phase delay so that left to right and right to left scanned pixels are perfectly aligned in the vertical direction. However, in case one can observe a misalignment (display appears out of focus), this function allows the host to manipulate the phase delay. This manual override should not be needed in normal operation. This function sets scan line phase delay value.
        Specified by:
        PicoP_SetBiPhase in interface IPicoP_Api
        Parameters:
        connectionHandle - A valid library PicoP_Handle previously obtained by a call to PicoP_OpenLibrary()
        sPhaseValue - Value for the horizontal phase offset (Range -100 ... +100)
        bCommit - False = Do not persist (value restored back after power cycle), True = Persist setting
        Returns:
        PicoP_RC

      • PicoP_GetBiPhase

        public PicoP_RC PicoP_GetBiPhase(PicoP_Handle connectionHandle,
                                 PicoP_Api.PicoP_Callback callback,
                                 PicoP_ValueStorageTypeE storageType)
        Description copied from interface: IPicoP_Api
        Returns scan line phase delay value.
        Specified by:

      • PicoP_SetSensingState

                                      boolean bCommit)
        Description copied from interface: IPicoP_Api
        Set the 3D Sensing function On or Off. When the 3D Sensing function is off, the IR laser is not pulsing and no 3D sensing data is sent over the Parallel Camera or MIPI-CSI2 interfaces.
